an6.86:4.1: “Mendicants, someone with six qualities is unable to arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities even when listening to the true teaching.
an6.86:4.3: They’re obstructed by deeds, defilements, or results. And they’re faithless, unenthusiastic, and witless.
an6.86:4.4: Someone with these six qualities is unable to arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities, even when listening to the true teaching.
an6.86:5.1: Someone with six qualities is able to arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities when listening to the true teaching.
an6.86:5.3: They’re not obstructed by deeds, defilements, or results. And they’re faithful, enthusiastic, and wise.
an6.86:5.4: Someone with these six qualities is able to arrive at certainty regarding the right path in wholesome qualities when listening to the true teaching.”
